nodes.bodyText: I don't think we need the new cache region or the new methods here.

Are we adding a new unneeded ES query here?  The SearchHits here should have the proper count and a majority of the time, that will return from cache.  I don't know why we need to do a separate query here.

We should always provide the default when calling Config.getStringProperty();
Also, we have a Config.getBooleanProperty(); that might be better to use here

I would change this to
return query.contains("+live:true") && !query.contains("+deleted:true")? info.getLive(): info.getWorking()
Do we need this if we are getting the correct total back from the SearchHits?
This one is always accurate. and does not depend on the track_total_hits
Our default should be 1,000,000 and this should not be set by default - we should not need to add this property to the dotmarketing-config.properties file.

@@ -522,6 +522,14 @@ CACHE_INVALIDATION_TRANSPORT_CLASS=com.dotcms.cache.transport.HazelcastCacheTran
 ## Cache elasticsearch query results
 ES_CACHE_SEARCH_QUERIES=true
 
+# This Property can be set to a positive numeric value or a boolean value
+# if set to false ES will stop retrieving the hits Count. DO NOT SET IT TO FALSE.

+# By default we're providing a max number.
+# If commented out ES will default to 10K again.
+# https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.10/search-your-data.html#track-total-hits
+ES_TRACK_TOTAL_HITS=1000000
